content:
• Tuesday, May 15, 2012
  • VRML

    Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML) says it's begun the process of identifying a successor to its current...

    Vermillion (NASDAQ:VRML) says it's begun the process of identifying a successor to its current President and CEO, Gail Page. The board has formed a search committee, with the goal of finding a replacement by September 2012. Shares +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM
  • THQIQ

    More on THQ (THQI): FQ4 beats estimates. Net losses widened however as the maker of videogames...

    More on THQ (THQI): FQ4 beats estimates. Net losses widened however as the maker of videogames and accessories continues to try to turn itself around following a disastrous dropoff in sales during the holiday shopping season. Shares -1.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM
  • OSUR

    An FDA advisory panel gives its unanimous approval to allow Orasure's (NASDAQ:OSUR) HIV test kit...

    An FDA advisory panel gives its unanimous approval to allow Orasure's (NASDAQ:OSUR) HIV test kit to be sold in retail stores, enabling consumers to test for the virus at home. The mouth-swab test is already sold commercially to health-care professionals, and the projected benefits" of an in-home HIV test outweigh the "potential risks of false positive and false negative results." The FDA usually follows panel recommendations. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • SINA

    More on Sina's Q1: With the monetization of Weibo a major concern of investors, the Street is...

    More on Sina's Q1: With the monetization of Weibo a major concern of investors, the Street is likely pleased with Sina's prediction that Weibo brand advertising, currently in the trial stage, will have a "meaningful impact" on 2H brand advertising revenue. EPS was hurt by a 17% Q/Q and 142% Y/Y increase in R&D expenses to $25M, and a 700 bps Y/Y drop in gross margin to 46%. Both figures have much to do with Sina's huge Weibo investments. SINA +6.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • BORN

    China New Borun (NYSE:BORN): Q1 EPS of $2.48 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $114.6M (+26% Y/Y) beats...

    China New Borun (NYSE:BORN): Q1 EPS of $2.48 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $114.6M (+26% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +9.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $106.2M (+6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Sina (NASDAQ:SINA): Q1 EPS of -$0.21 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $106.2M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $3.6M. Expects Q2 revenue of $126M-$129M, below $130.4M consensus. Shares +6.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • VELTF

    More on Velti (VELT): Q1 beats on both EPS and revenue with a 75% Y/Y jump in total sales. SaaS...

    More on Velti (VELT): Q1 beats on both EPS and revenue with a 75% Y/Y jump in total sales. SaaS revenue contributed 90% of total revenue, in comparison to 79% for Q1 2011. License and managed services revenue fell to 3% and 7%, respectively, versus 9% and 12% in Q1 2011. The company also boosts Q2 and FY12 guidance, now expecting to see Q2 revenue of $55M - $59M. Street estimates are for $54M. Shares +4.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • KITD

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD): Q1 EPS of -$0.53 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $59M (+71% Y/Y) misses by...

    KIT digital (OTC:KITD): Q1 EPS of -$0.53 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $59M (+71% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • GM

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) up 4.1% after hours as Berkshire Hathaway discloses a 10M-share...

    General Motors (NYSE:GM) up 4.1% after hours as Berkshire Hathaway discloses a 10M-share holding. Record earnings at operating businesses have Warren Buffett's firm investing more funds into stocks. (Berkshire's 13F)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • JCP

    More on the J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) Q1 meltdown: Same-store sales down 19% in Q1, total sales...

    More on the J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) Q1 meltdown: Same-store sales down 19% in Q1, total sales down 20.1%. Despite the numbers and calls for additional restructuring charges, the company maintains that the transformation is "ahead of schedule." How bad is it? $JCP is a trending topic on Twitter right now. Shares -13.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 5 Comments
  • VIEW

    Cogo Group (COGO): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $169.3M (+62% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Cogo Group (COGO): Q1 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $169.3M (+62% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +7.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • JCP

    More on J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP): The company cuts its FY12 forecast, saying it won't meet EPS...

    More on J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP): The company cuts its FY12 forecast, saying it won't meet EPS estimates of $1.59, likely due to inventory write-downs.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • QRVO

    Mobile power amplifier vendors TriQuint (TQNT) and Avago (NASDAQ:AVGO) have agreed to end all...

    Mobile power amplifier vendors TriQuint (TQNT) and Avago (NASDAQ:AVGO) have agreed to end all outstanding litigation between the companies, and enter into a patent cross-licensing agreement. The terms of the agreement remain confidential. TQNT +5.3% AH. AVGO +0.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $-0.15. Revenue of $3.15B misses by $0.3B....

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP): Q1 EPS of -$0.25 misses by $-0.15. Revenue of $3.15B misses by $0.3B. Discontinues $0.20 quarterly dividend. Shares -14.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 9 Comments
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (VOXX +19.1%) is one of the day's top gainers after reporting FQ4 sales rose...

    VOXX International (VOXX +19.1%) is one of the day's top gainers after reporting FQ4 sales rose 26% Y/Y, though expenses also jumped. EPS handily beat analysts' estimates, as the audio products maker's profit mix shifted toward higher margin growth categories.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • AVP

    Avon (AVP -8.7%) jumps off of a double-digit loss on a Bloomberg report jeweler Richemont is...

    Avon (AVP -8.7%) jumps off of a double-digit loss on a Bloomberg report jeweler Richemont is interested in the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +10.5%) and Yelp (YELP +4.2%) are two more fast-growing Internet names that appear to...

    Pandora (P +10.5%) and Yelp (YELP +4.2%) are two more fast-growing Internet names that appear to be getting a boost from the lifting of Facebook's IPO price range (previous). In Pandora's case, short-covering is also probably playing a role, given 29.9% of its float was shorted as of April 30. Meanwhile, Groupon (GRPN +4%), which soared yesterday ahead of its strong Q1 report, has given up most of today's early gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CHNG

    The SEC accuses China Natural Gas (OTC:CHNG -9.3%) and former CEO Qinan Ji of secretly lending...

    The SEC accuses China Natural Gas (OTC:CHNG -9.3%) and former CEO Qinan Ji of secretly lending more than $14M in company funds to benefit his son and nephew. Ji, who resigned as CEO last October, approved both loans without obtaining authorization from the company's board or informing its CFO, the SEC says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • RCM

    Accretive Health (AH +3.7%) says prominent health care and policy leaders have agreed to convene...

    Accretive Health (AH +3.7%) says prominent health care and policy leaders have agreed to convene to develop a process for implementing national standards for how hospitals and other providers interact with patients regarding their financial obligations. The standards will aim to cover expected charges, available resources, counseling, billing and payment procedures regardless of the ability to pay.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • SMG

    Shares of Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG -1.2%) dip after Moody's cut its outlook to stable from...

    Shares of Scotts Miracle-Gro (SMG -1.2%) dip after Moody's cut its outlook to stable from positive earlier today, saying higher advertising expenses and raw material costs will continue to put pressure on margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • THM

    International Tower Hills Mines (THM -20.2%) says CEO James Komadina is resigning to spend more...

    International Tower Hills Mines (THM -20.2%) says CEO James Komadina is resigning to spend more time with his family, and has begun a search for a replacement. The gold mining company also says it is reviewing its keystone Livengood Gold Project, including infrastructure and processing options and financing opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake’s (CHK -5.6%) 1.5M acres in the Permian Basin may be worth $6.82B, $1.8B more...

    Chesapeake’s (CHK -5.6%) 1.5M acres in the Permian Basin may be worth $6.82B, $1.8B more than expected, based on the price Concho Resources agreed to pay this week for oil fields in the same area. Anadarko (NYSE:APC) CEO Al Walker says he'll take a look at CHK’s Permian assets; Occidental Petroleum (NYSE:OXY) had a bid for CHK assets rejected, Forbes reported.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 4 Comments
  • TMO

    Life Technologies (LIFE -0.3%) and Thermo Fisher (TMO -0.8%) both slip today after Mizuho cut...

    Life Technologies (LIFE -0.3%) and Thermo Fisher (TMO -0.8%) both slip today after Mizuho cut the stocks to Neutral (I,II), citing uncertainty surrounding academic spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -2.7%) sells off after its presentation at a JPMorgan conference (webcast) fails...

    Fusion-io (FIO -2.7%) sells off after its presentation at a JPMorgan conference (webcast) fails to impress. Piper's Andrew Nowinski, who issued bullish notes on Fusion-io in February and April, thinks investor concerns about the company's June quarter being back-end loaded due to server OEM product qualifications are taking a toll, but believes this is baked into guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • GPRC

    Shares of Chinese plastic recycler Guanwei Recycling (GPRC -25%) crater after posting...

    Shares of Chinese plastic recycler Guanwei Recycling (GPRC -25%) crater after posting mid-session earnings that disappointed analysts. The company reported Q1 EPS of $0.10 on sales of $16.2M. Management also says that material weakness reported in 2011 was "unremediated" and that its controls and procedures are still not effective. (Form 10-Q)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • FLEX

    Flextronics (FLEX +3.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Buy from BofA, which was pleased with...

    Flextronics (FLEX +3.8%) jumps on an upgrade to Buy from BofA, which was pleased with management's presentation (transcript - PDF) at a recent conference. The firm is now more convinced the contract manufacturing giant is well-positioned to increase margins thanks to a mix shift away from low-margin PC/BlackBerry assembly work, along with revenue increases, restructuring efforts, and the use of in-house components.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • ANGI

    Shares of Angie's List (ANGI -5.5%) trail off after the company announces a secondary offering...

    Shares of Angie's List (ANGI -5.5%) trail off after the company announces a secondary offering of 8.4M shares held by existing shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Patriot Coal's (PXC -16.1%) downward guidance in its metallurgical coal sales volume for the...

    Patriot Coal's (PXC -16.1%) downward guidance in its metallurgical coal sales volume for the rest of the year is dragging down the entire sector (KOL -1.9%). Among heavy miners of met coal, such as Alpha Natural (ANR -7.4%) and Walter Energy (WLT -5%), the drops are the worst. Also: BTU -4.7%, CNX -4.6%, ACI -4.5%, JRCC -3.9%, CLD -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 13 Comments
  • BLOX

    Infoblox (BLOX -2%), which had a solid IPO last month, trades lower after Morgan Stanley and...

    Infoblox (BLOX -2%), which had a solid IPO last month, trades lower after Morgan Stanley and Goldman start coverage with neutral ratings. MS thinks Infoblox's valuation already reflects high expectations, and "beat and raise quarters" aren't guaranteed in light of Cisco's guidance. Goldman touts Infoblox's "best-of-breed" network management solutions, but thinks a discount relative to peers is warranted given lower growth and margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • LWAY

    Shares of Lifeway Foods (LWAY +6.5%) shoot higher after the company announces that it signed a...

    Shares of Lifeway Foods (LWAY +6.5%) shoot higher after the company announces that it signed a deal to dramatically increase distribution of its kefir line in Target stores and add new Lifeway products to the retailer's dairy cases.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • LXU

    LSB Industries (LXU -22.8%) says its chemical facility in El Dorado, Ark. suffered significant...

    LSB Industries (LXU -22.8%) says its chemical facility in El Dorado, Ark. suffered significant damage to its concentrated nitric acid plant and surrounding equipment after a reactor exploded. The facility will be out of operation for an unknown period. The company believes there was no environmental release.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • JNJ

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ +0.5%) subsidiary Alza Corp. and Janssen Pharmaceutica NV agree to...

    Johnson & Johnson's (JNJ +0.5%) subsidiary Alza Corp. and Janssen Pharmaceutica NV agree to transfer world-wide rights for the premature ejaculation treatment Priligy to drug developer Furiex Pharmaceuticals (FURX +9.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper Networks (JNPR +2.9%), which closed on Monday not far from its 52-week low, is rallying...

    Juniper Networks (JNPR +2.9%), which closed on Monday not far from its 52-week low, is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from BofA. While admitting Juniper has lost share in some markets, the firm sees improving carrier capex (particularly in North America) and new router and switch launches giving the company a lift.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • RCM

    Shares of Accretive Health (AH +4.4%) bounce after the company submits a 29-page reply to...

    Shares of Accretive Health (AH +4.4%) bounce after the company submits a 29-page reply to questions raised by Senator Al Franken after Minnesota's AG alleged that AH used potentially illegal tactics to collect payments from patients at a Minnesota health facility. In its reply the company insisted it did not violate any federal laws related to patient privacy or debt collection and said it "appreciates the opportunity to set the record straight."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +13.2%) soars in mid-day trading after receiving a positive mention on CNBC's...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +13.2%) soars in mid-day trading after receiving a positive mention on CNBC's Fast Money as a social gaming play.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • SWI

    SolarWinds (SWI +3.9%) and Splunk (SPLK +1.4%) outperform after being mentioned positively in...

    SolarWinds (SWI +3.9%) and Splunk (SPLK +1.4%) outperform after being mentioned positively in Elliott Associates' open letter to BMC Software's (BMC +1.6%) board. The enterprise software firms are named as companies BMC should have acquired to bolster its software-as-a-service (SaaS) offerings, but are now too richly priced to justify a purchase. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • BMY

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals' (AMLN +6%) annual shareholder meeting is over and CEO Dan Bradbury made...

    Amylin Pharmaceuticals' (AMLN +6%) annual shareholder meeting is over and CEO Dan Bradbury made no comment on speculation the drug maker is talking to potential suitors, as has been reported. Bradbury did talk up prospects for its new diabetes drug Bydureon and Metreleptin, a potential new drug for metabolic disorder in rare diseases. (presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • CSOD

    Off initially after reporting an in-line Q1, Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +9.2%) is now shooting...

    Off initially after reporting an in-line Q1, Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +9.2%) is now shooting higher, no doubt thanks to its earnings call guidance. The cloud HR software firm expects Q2 revenue of $26M-$26.5M and 2012 revenue of $114.5M-$116.5M; the former is in-line, but the latter is above a consensus of $113.6M. In addition, Cornerstone's Q1 bookings grew 67% Y/Y to $24M - that's an acceleration from Q4's 58% growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • CQP

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP -3.5%) agrees to sell $1.5B in stock to investors affiliated with...

    Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP -3.5%) agrees to sell $1.5B in stock to investors affiliated with Blackstone (NYSE:BX) at a 40% discount to the company's Monday closing stock price, in its continued aggressive effort to raise funds for construction of the Sabine Pass natural gas export facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 12 Comments
  • AMED

    Amedisys (AMED +1.9%) gives back much of an early morning pop after Baird issued a cautious...

    Amedisys (AMED +1.9%) gives back much of an early morning pop after Baird issued a cautious valuation upgrade on the shares to Neutral, saying that despite the ratings change investors should still stay away from the home-health sector. Baird sees the space remaining vulnerable postelection and potentially getting hit by this summer's annual Medicare rulemaking session.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • LPRI

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR -20.5%) shares are slammed after reporting a Q1 EPS loss of $0.07 vs....

    Lone Pine Resources (LPR -20.5%) shares are slammed after reporting a Q1 EPS loss of $0.07 vs. the consensus estimate of a $0.12 profit, and revenues that fell well short of estimates. Oil production rose, but gains were reduced by higher operating expenses and interest expense. LPR also lowered its full-year sales guidance due to production delays.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +3.1%) move higher after the firm announces that it will sell its...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +3.1%) move higher after the firm announces that it will sell its invisibleSHIELD electronics protector products in over 900 Walmart stores across the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • TOL

    Homebuilding stocks get a lift from a positive NAHB number this morning, as the sentiment...

    Homebuilding stocks get a lift from a positive NAHB number this morning, as the sentiment reading for this month climbed to its highest level in five years. It's important to note however, that despite the improvement in starts, home building still remains well off normal levels. Anything above 50 suggests a positive view of home building conditions, and this index hasn't had a positive reading since April 2006. Toll Brothers (TOL +2.9%), KB Home (KBH +3.7%), Lennar (LEN +3.7%), Hovnanian (HOV +5%), D R Horton (DHI _3.5%), PulteGroup (PHM +1.8%) S&P Homebuilders ETF (XHB +1.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • GLDD

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD +2.8%) is started at Outperform by Imperial Capital, which...

    Great Lakes Dredge & Dock (GLDD +2.8%) is started at Outperform by Imperial Capital, which says GLDD is positioned to benefit from increased spending for dredging in coming years, driven by a catch-up in maintenance dredging after years of underinvestment and the need to deepen ports for post-Panamax ships once Panama Canal expansion is compete.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • BMY

    Amylin (AMLN) +6% to $27.19 on reports that it's attracted multiple suitors. Leerink Swann...

    Amylin (AMLN) +6% to $27.19 on reports that it's attracted multiple suitors. Leerink Swann analysts reckon Sanofi (NASDAQ:SNY) and Merck (NYSE:MRK) will emerge as the strongest bidders, and predict a sale price in the mid-$30 a share, although it could go higher if there's a bidding war for the biotech firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM | 1 Comment
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +2.7%) catches a bid on an upgrade to Buy from Janney's Richard Fetyko, who says an...

    Akamai (AKAM +2.7%) catches a bid on an upgrade to Buy from Janney's Richard Fetyko, who says an HQ visit left him more confident about accelerating 2H revenue growth for Akamai's high-margin cloud delivery business, whose Q1 sales were disappointing. Fetyko also sees less competitive risk from telcos and rival content delivery network (CDN) owner Limelight (NASDAQ:LLNW), and better pricing trends. Akamai was hammered by weak EPS and margin guidance last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MIPS

    MIPS (MIPS +6.7%) rallies after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Benchmark's Gary Mobley, who...

    MIPS (MIPS +6.7%) rallies after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Benchmark's Gary Mobley, who thinks the present royalty value of MIPS' patent portfolio is $3.40/share, or nearly half its current stock price. Mobley adds a court could find "some portion of MIPS' competition" is violating its IP. It was reported last month that MIPS has hired Goldman to find a buyer, and a later report claimed AMD is among the interested parties.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 1 Comment
  • CNQ

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -1.7%) shares slide a day after the country's biggest energy...

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -1.7%) shares slide a day after the country's biggest energy company was charged with violating national environmental laws by releasing a potentially dangerous amount of hydrogen sulphide gas into the Northern Alberta air two years ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health (GTIV +11.3%) pops on an upgrade to Neutral on valuation at Baird with a price...

    Gentiva Health (GTIV +11.3%) pops on an upgrade to Neutral on valuation at Baird with a price target of $6.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +12%), crushed over the last 12 months due to a litany of problems (I, II,...

    A123 Systems (AONE +12%), crushed over the last 12 months due to a litany of problems (I, II, III), is rallying post-earnings. Though A123's numbers badly missed estimates and the company reported cash burn of $73M, it also said it has fixed the battery defect that led to a massive recall, and that a federal grant with $120M in remaining proceeds has been extended by 2 years. A123 slashed its 2012 guidance last Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD +3.9%) gets a lift on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at UBS this morning, citing...

    Cepheid (CPHD +3.9%) gets a lift on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at UBS this morning, citing the company's solid business momentum. The firm also raises its price target raised to $45 from $44.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +1.8%) trade up after Q1 results at Dick's Sporting Goods point to...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +1.8%) trade up after Q1 results at Dick's Sporting Goods point to the possibility that sales of the firm's products may be strong. Along with Sports Authority, Dick's stores account for around a quarter of UA's total revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK -3.9%) reportedly increased the size of the $3B bridge loan it’s seeking...

    Chesapeake (CHK -3.9%) reportedly increased the size of the $3B bridge loan it’s seeking to refinance debt to $4B; the debt will now be sold at $0.97 on the dollar, up from $0.96, increasing proceeds for the company and reducing the yield to investors. Earlier today, S&P cut CHK's credit rating to BB- from BB.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • A

    Agilent (NYSE:A) +5.6% following its FQ2 earnings beat yesterday. Net income +28% to $255M,...

    Agilent (NYSE:A) +5.6% following its FQ2 earnings beat yesterday. Net income +28% to $255M, boosted by stronger orders. Guidance: FQ3 EPS of $0.82-$0.84 vs. consenus of $0.84, revenue of $1.77B-$1.79B vs. $1.76B. FY EPS of $3.18-$3.24 vs. previous forecast of $3.13-$3.23, revenue of $6.94B-$7B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • TJX

    Shares of TJX (TJX +6.3%) shoot up after the company beats profit estimates by a penny in Q1 and...

    Shares of TJX (TJX +6.3%) shoot up after the company beats profit estimates by a penny in Q1 and raises its guidance for FY13. The home fashions retailer now sees EPS in a range of $0.47-$0.50, with comparable-store sales humming along at a 2%-4% clip.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • AMAT

    Needham makes a bearish call on chip equipment stocks, and is downgrading Applied Materials...

    Needham makes a bearish call on chip equipment stocks, and is downgrading Applied Materials (AMAT +0.1%), Ultra Clean Holdings (UCTT -4.3%), and Nova Measuring (NVMI -2.9%) in the process. The firm thinks order rates from major chip manufacturers are decelerating, and is less confident memory capex (ed: no doubt affected by Elpida's bankruptcy and falling flash prices) will rebound in the near-term. Thus, it thinks the Street's growth forecasts are too high.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC +6.5%) and the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +3.9%), each of which...

    GSV Capital (GSVC +6.5%) and the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +3.9%), each of which have taken out sizable Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) positions, are adding to yesterday's gains after the social networking giant raised its IPO price range to $34-$38. Zynga (ZNGA +5.9%), which derives most of its revenue from Facebook, is also rallying. Also higher: QPSA +5.4%. RENN +8.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN +18%) skyrockets following its Q1 beat and strong Q2 guidance, fueled by surging...

    Groupon (GRPN +18%) skyrockets following its Q1 beat and strong Q2 guidance, fueled by surging North American sales that suggest the company is gaining share against old and new domestic rivals. Citi and Sterne Agee are upgrading Groupon, with each praising its operating leverage (long a concern for the Street). Deutsche, however, is worried the lower marketing expenses reported by Groupon won't last, and Stifel thinks shares could fade ahead of the June 1 IPO lockup expiration.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • CHK

    S&P downgrades Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) to BB- from BB with a negative outlook. "Given...

    S&P downgrades Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) to BB- from BB with a negative outlook. "Given revised production expectations, external funding needs are likely to be higher over the next two years than we previously assumed,"S&P says. CHK -3% premarket.
